explanation: Agent A is correct. The for loop uses i as the single loop counter (for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)) but the loop body also increments i (several occurrences of ++i and one ++i in an else). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 (clause 4) requires the loop counter not be modified in the loop body (only the third clause may modify it). Because i is modified inside the body, the loop is not well-formed under Rule 14.2 and thus the reported violation is valid.
